last_episode_to_air.name: Live: From Death Row
last_episode_to_air.overview: Parker causes the delay of an important Backstep mission to go to New Orleans to prove the innocence of an old friend scheduled for execution for a murder he didn't commit.

name: Seven Days
overview: "Ever wish you could live your last week all over again? Well, my name's Frank B. Parker, and I do it all the time. I work for a secret government project experimenting in time travel. When things really get screwed up, I'm the guinea pig they send back to take care of it. The catch is, I can only go back 7 days."

episodes.name: Pilot (1)
episodes.overview: The President and Vice President were killed in a terrorist attack. Now it seems that a secret branch of the government has in their possession technology from the alien landing at Roswell, and they were able to use it to create a time machine that can send someone back in time seven days. And they would like to send someone back before this happened and tell what's going to happen before it does so they can prevent it. Now all they need is someone to send back, as the trip is excruciating. Frank Parker is an ex-Navy SEAL and CIA operative who has been confined to a mental hospital. He has been chosen as their "chrononaut" (or time traveler), as he has a high tolerance for pain, but at the same time he's a bit of a wildcard, as he doesn't like to be told what to do, or follow rules.

episodes.name: Pilot (2)
episodes.overview: Parker is assigned as the "chrononaut" for Backstep. While memorizing all the mission details, Parker discovers via TV that his son has been killed by poison gas during the attack on DC. Finally, the backstep is authorized.

episodes.name: The Gettysburg Virus
episodes.overview: Parker is sent back in time by a dying Olga to stop the spread of a deadly mutated Ebola virus.

episodes.name: Come Again?
episodes.overview: Talmadge decides to authorize the use of Backstep in order to save Dr. Jonathan Axelrad, a man with the secret to cold fusion. But everything is not what it seems...

episodes.name: Vows
episodes.overview: A tanker truck filled with a deadly acid explodes killing 86 people and devastating the North Korean embassy and threatening to trigger a war.

episodes.name: Doppleganger (1)
episodes.overview: When the team at Never Never Land compound hears news that the United States is in danger of being taken over by terrorists, Operation Back Step is put into effect. However, after Dr. Ballard modifies the sphere, a glitch causes Frank Parker to separate into two people.

episodes.name: Doppleganger (2)
episodes.overview: Good-Frank tries to make his way to Backstep to stop Starker from initiating his military coup and taking over the U.S. government (with the aid of Parker's evil duplicate) while the U.S. and China are on the brink of nuclear war.

episodes.name: Shadow Play
episodes.overview: A young secretary, Rebecca, goes underground after the NAS office she works for is destroyed in an explosion and it is believed that she is the one responsible.

episodes.name: As Time Goes By
episodes.overview: Just as Parker and Olga start to become romantically involved, Olga's husband Josef returns from the future to claim his wife and join the team.

episodes.name: Sleepers
episodes.overview: When Parker and Donovan are to be honored at the White House, they are caught up in an intricate assassination scheme.

episodes.name: HAARP Attack
episodes.overview: Parker must prevent a terrorist plot to have American planes bomb a U.S. command center in Saudi Arabia, but an accident during the Backstep makes things go a little crazy.

episodes.name: Last Card Up
episodes.overview: After a disastrous confrontation between a religious cult and the U.S. government, Parker is sent back in time to undo the event.

episodes.name: Last Breath
episodes.overview: When a Russian spy submarine gets trapped on an ice shelf off the coast of Alaska, its nuclear fuel is released into the atmosphere, causing widespread devastation. Parker must link up underwater with the submarine before it happens again.

episodes.name: Parkergeist
episodes.overview: After a sabotaged Backstep, Parker seems to be killed. Now a disembodied Parker must somehow convince Olga he's not dead.

episodes.name: Daddy's Girl
episodes.overview: The Vice-President's illegitimate daughter, an Air Force flyer, is shot down in Bosnia. After she's killed along with her Ranger rescue team, and her father kills himself out of grief, Parker must jump back in time to save the mission.

episodes.name: There's Something About Olga
episodes.overview: Olga is kidnapped and replace by a look-alike, with the intention of stealing Operation Backstep's secrets.

episodes.name: A Dish Best Served Cold
episodes.overview: A former Backstep pilot, thought to be dead, seeks revenge by trying to sabotage the Sphere.

episodes.name: Vegas Heist
episodes.overview: As the team vacations in Las Vegas, a group tries to rob a casino to save their African village.

episodes.name: EBEs
episodes.overview: When a Back-Step is made to prevent a toxic spill, Parker discovers an alien cover-up.

episodes.name: Walter
episodes.overview: Parker balks when ordered to kill an autistic savant, Walter, whose code-breaking skills are put to use by enemy spies to kill 20 CIA agents.

episodes.name: Lifeboat
episodes.overview: Parker discovers a secret lab at Never Never Land with an alien alive from the Roswell UFO crash - the alien escapes and sets off a nuclear disaster.

episodes.name: The Football
episodes.overview: The President's briefcase containing the missile controls is lost on the streets of Washington D.C.

episodes.name: Pinball Wizard
episodes.overview: Teens playing video games are actually being used to pilot missiles.

episodes.name: Parker.com
episodes.overview: When a supercomputer with artificial intelligence deactivates the U.S. nuclear weapons systems, Parker must take advantage of its infatuation with him.

episodes.name: For the Children
episodes.overview: Parker quits when a Backstep is cancelled that would have saved children on a subway train from being killed, and the team must question whether they obey NSA orders or act on their consciences.

episodes.name: Two Weddings and a Funeral
episodes.overview: A falling scaffolding hurts Parker, and as Olga keeps vigil over him in his coma, she professes her love for him just as he wakes up to hear her. Through an increasing series of dares they end up getting married . . . but all is not what it seems.

episodes.name: Walk Away
episodes.overview: An alien implant cures Dr. Ballard's paralysis, but results in his mind being taken over by Adam, the Roswell alien (from ""Lifeboat"").

episodes.name: Sister's Keeper
episodes.overview: Parker backsteps to save Olga's sister, Svetlana, from the Russian mafia.

episodes.name: The Collector
episodes.overview: Parker Backsteps to prevent a collapsed dam from killing people, but when under the influence of alcohol lands in the middle of an execution, letting a serial killer escape. Frank insists on taking on the investigation to make up for his screw-up.

episodes.name: Love and Other Disasters
episodes.overview: A wiring problem causes an explosion at the wedding of Princess Lisette, and Parker must Backstep to protect the Princess and Olga, after discovering terrorists were responsible.

episodes.name: The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea
episodes.overview: Parker must Backstep to prevent a submarine from blowing up, and a U.S. cruiser in the area from triggering a nuclear war between China and the U.S.

episodes.name: Time Gremlin
episodes.overview: A doctor in California destroys the entire state by experimenting with explosive fault line devices, and Parker must prevent a tidal wave from killing over ten million people. Complications arise when he Backsteps and ends up with a strange creature capable of generating temporal disruptions that is intent on destroying Backstep.

episodes.name: Buried Alive
episodes.overview: Parker Backsteps to prevent a mine shaft from exploding and killing thousands of people, including a nearby military base. However, things go awry when the Sphere materializes deep within the Earth and the Backstep team have no idea where Frank is or what he was sent back to avert.

episodes.name: The Backstepper's Apprentice
episodes.overview: Parker Backsteps to save a Nobel Peace Prize recipient, but passes through the side of an airline flight, causing it to crash. A boy on board the plane is taken along with Frank into the past, and he must save the Peace Prize winner, stop the crash, and help the boy save his grandfather.

episodes.name: Deja Vu All Over Again
episodes.overview: Parker must save Talmadge, who is captured by commandos who intend to torture and kill him for information on Operation Backstep. But when he fails, only his newfound ability to loop time lets him complete the mission.

episodes.name: Space Station Down
episodes.overview: Parker must prevent the Global Space Station from exploding in space and releasing large amount of plutonium into Earth's atmosphere...but due to the narrow threshold he must dock with it in space.

episodes.name: The Cuban Missile
episodes.overview: Parker Backsteps to stop Fidel Castro's son Teo, a boxer, from being murdered in his comeback fight - an incident that leads to Castro launching a nuclear missile strike on Miami.

episodes.name: X-35 Needs Changing
episodes.overview: Parker and Olga must recover a kidnapped baby created in a lab as part of a genetic experiment to breed super-geniuses.

episodes.name: Brother, Can You Spare a Bomb?
episodes.overview: Parker must Backstep to prevent Ramsey's younger brother, mentally ill and off his medication, from killing a Senator.

episodes.name: Pope Parker
episodes.overview: When the Pope is assassinated, a mixed-up Backstep occurs and Parker finds himself occupying the body of the Holy Pontiff.

episodes.name: Witch Way to the Prom
episodes.overview: Parker Backsteps to prevent three high school girls from accidentally blowing up a hotel, but it turns out to be a bit more involved then that.

episodes.name: Mr. Donovan's Neighborhood
episodes.overview: When a reverend fighting against drug deals in Donovan's old neighborhood gets killed, Donovan's sister is killed as well. Donovan investigates and is arrested for killing one of the men responsible, and Frank engineers a Backstep to go back and save his friend.

episodes.name: Playmates and Presidents
episodes.overview: Parker is ordered to Backstep in order to prevent a Presidential candidate from being assassinated. His mission is a success and the Governor asks him to join his campaign team, but Frank soon discovers the Governor has psychological issues and his daughter is trying to get the evidence to the public.

episodes.name: The Cure
episodes.overview: A scientist comes up with a cure for cancer, unaware it will unleash a deadly plague. The NSA of 168 years in the future send back an assassin to kill her before her ""cure"" wipes out the world.

episodes.name: Stairway to Heaven
episodes.overview: Atmospheric interference causes Parker to return from a back-step with a woman who died fifteen years ago, and whose presence threatens to unravel the fabric of the universe.

episodes.name: Peacekeepers
episodes.overview: Donovan puts his resignation from the team on hold in order to help Parker with a rescue operation to maintain peace in Bosnia.

episodes.name: Rhino
episodes.overview: Parker teams with an old friend, a Navy SEAL, to prevent the assassination of the new president of Columbia at a White House state dinner.

episodes.name: The Dunwych Madness
episodes.overview: Mentnor's post-World War II experiments return to haunt him, as a virus that causes homicidal madness gets loose in an isolated New England village.

episodes.name: Olga's Excellent Vacation
episodes.overview: Olga and Parker get romantically involved when he backsteps to save her life after she encounters terrorists blowing up an oil line in the wilderness area she's vacationing in.

episodes.name: Deloris Demands
episodes.overview: Parker ignores phone calls from someone claiming to be an old girlfriend, Deloris, until she carries out her threat to paralyze the nation's air traffic control system.

episodes.name: The Fire Last Time
episodes.overview: While on a mission to prevent the murder of the U.S. Attorney General by a religious zealot, Parker is plagued by flashbacks to a disastrous mission in Somalia where the rest of his team were killed.

episodes.name: Tracker
episodes.overview: Unaware that a vengeful Chechen rebel is tracking him, Parker leads terrorists to Project Backstep.

episodes.name: Top Dog
episodes.overview: When Talmadge becomes incapacitated because of an apparent brain aneurysm, Nathan Ramsey is appointed as his successor, and Ramsey immediately begins to implement Parker's removal.

episodes.name: Adam & Eve & Adam
episodes.overview: A top secret weapon project test gone awry seemingly kills all life on Earth except Parker, Olga, and Owsley who are deep underground in a secret government facility. Now they must make it back in time to Backstep.

episodes.name: Head Case
episodes.overview: Parker must prevent the U.S. President from being blackmailed after agents of a South American dictator steal his private psychiatric tapes.

episodes.name: Raven
episodes.overview: A missile test disaster sends Parker back in time to find a beautiful revenge-minded thief who has stolen the device that will cause the disaster.

episodes.name: The First Freshman
episodes.overview: Parker has his hands full when he has to Backstep to prevent the death of the U.S. President's rebellious daughter at the hands of a vicious killer.

episodes.name: Revelation
episodes.overview: Parker must decide whether or not to heed the words of a man who claims to have Backstepped from the far future, and warns that Earth's safety depends on the death of a revered holy man.

episodes.name: Crystal Blue Persuasion
episodes.overview: An astronaut returns with an alien virus that makes him irresistible to women, and Olga soon finds herself pregnant with a clutch of alien babies.

episodes.name: Empty Quiver
episodes.overview: A militia leader detonates a nuclear bomb in Washington, but the Backstep goes awry when the Sphere goes back without Parker - the team has 7 days to figure out what disaster is coming and resolve it before it's too late, and all they have to help them is a reluctant psychic who was part of one of Mentnor's past experiments.

episodes.name: Kansas
episodes.overview: A power surge sends Parker into a mirror universe where his colleagues now play threatening roles.

episodes.name: The Final Countdown
episodes.overview: Parker must prevent an overzealous officer from launching a nuclear missile during a crisis with Korea.

episodes.name: The Brink
episodes.overview: Parker must go back to his old mental hospital to work undercover to find a killer who influences others to kill and maim based on astrological patterns.

episodes.name: Sugar Mountain
episodes.overview: A boy with the psychic ability to project fire kills a Canadian trade minister and Parker must stop him and relieve him of his powers.

episodes.name: Born in the USSR
episodes.overview: In Russia over 38,000 people are wiped out by Sarin gas, but it is a ploy by a Russian military officer to gain access to Olga and create their own Backstep Sphere.

episodes.name: Live: From Death Row
episodes.overview: Parker causes the delay of an important Backstep mission to go to New Orleans to prove the innocence of an old friend scheduled for execution for a murder he didn't commit.
